title: Angular momentum - same rotational kinetic energy

content.question: Two rotating objects, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, have equal rotational kinetic energies. Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has rotational inertia <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>, and Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has rotational inertia <math alttext="2 I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>I</mi></math>. What is the ratio of the angular momenta, <math alttext="L sub A to L sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, of the two objects?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 to the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the square root of 2 to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>:</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1 to the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
